intro: Anthenantia rufa, commonly known as the red-flowered sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Anthenantia rufa is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is well-suited to xerophytic conditions.
